channel.title: This American Life
channel.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.
channel.itunes:author: This American Life
channel.itunes:subtitle: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast.

item.title: 690: Too Close to Home
item.description: For the holidays, stories of families finally addressing the thorny thing they’ve never really talked about.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: For the holidays, stories of families finally addressing the thorny thing they’ve never really talked about.
item.itunes:summary: For the holidays, stories of families finally addressing the thorny thing they’ve never really talked about.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 576: Say Yes To Christmas
item.description: No Christmas can ever be as good as the ones you had as a kid. But this week we go all in and bring the joy, the spontaneity, the sense that anything can happen back to Christmas.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: We go all in and bring the joy, the spontaneity, the sense that anything can happen back to Christmas.
item.itunes:summary: No Christmas can ever be as good as the ones you had as a kid. But this week we go all in and bring the joy, the spontaneity, the sense that anything can happen back to Christmas.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 323: The Super
item.description: Stories of the mysterious hold supers have on their buildings, or their buildings have on them.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of the mysterious hold supers have on their buildings, or their buildings have on them.
item.itunes:summary: Stories of the mysterious hold supers have on their buildings, or their buildings have on them.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 689: Digging Up the Bones
item.description: There's a lot that can be gained from unearthing the past -- learning about oneself, learning about others. But, it doesn't always go how you'd expect.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: There's a lot that can be gained from unearthing the past -- learning about oneself, learning about others. But, it doesn't always go how you'd expect.
item.itunes:summary: There's a lot that can be gained from unearthing the past -- learning about oneself, learning about others. But, it doesn't always go how you'd expect.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 688: The Out Crowd
item.description: Reports from the frontlines of the Trump administration's "Remain in Mexico" asylum policy. We hear from asylum seekers waiting across the border in Mexico, in a makeshift refugee camp,  and from the officers who sent them there to wait in the first place.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Reports from the frontlines of the Trump administration's "Remain in Mexico" asylum policy.
item.itunes:summary: Reports from the frontlines of the Trump administration's "Remain in Mexico" asylum policy. We hear from asylum seekers waiting across the border in Mexico, in a makeshift refugee camp, and from the officers who sent them there to wait in the first place.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 687: Small Things Considered
item.description: Stories about being little. Secret writings in tiny letters. The power of a very small number. And a medication that's supposed to cure shortness.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories about being little. Secret writings in tiny letters. The power of a very small number. And a medication that's supposed to cure shortness.
item.itunes:summary: Stories about being little. Secret writings in tiny letters. The power of a very small number. And a medication that's supposed to cure shortness.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 686: Umbrellas Up
item.description: For over 100 days now, protesters in Hong Kong have taken to the streets every weekend. What it’s like to live through that.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: For over 100 days now, protesters in Hong Kong have taken to the streets every weekend. What it’s like to live through that.
item.itunes:summary: For over 100 days now, protesters in Hong Kong have taken to the streets every weekend. What it’s like to live through that.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 685: We Come From Small Places
item.description: The staff goes to one of the biggest parties in New York City, the Labor Day Carnival and the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: The staff goes to one of the biggest parties in New York City, the Labor Day Carnival and the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn.
item.itunes:summary: The staff goes to one of the biggest parties in New York City, the Labor Day Carnival and the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 684: Burn It Down
item.description: Stories of people who decide the only way forward — for real change — is to burn everything to the ground.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of people who decide the only way forward — for real change — is to burn everything to the ground.
item.itunes:summary: Stories of people who decide the only way forward — for real change — is to burn everything to the ground.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 683: Beer Summit
item.description: Two people, sitting down over a beer, hashing out their differences and understanding where the other guy is coming from. Hard to imagine these days, right? It's so rare right now that someone is curious enough to actually see the other person's point of view. This week on the show, beer summits. Including going behind the scenes of the most famous one ever.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Two people, sitting down over a beer, hashing out their differences. Hard to imagine these days, right?
